pull.title: guix: document when certain patches can be dropped
pull.body: Additional notes for when patches can be dropped.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -17,6 +17,8 @@ Date:   Fri May 6 11:03:04 2022 +0100
     https://sourceware.org/git/?p=glibc.git;a=commit;h=18363b4f010da9ba459b13310b113ac0647c2fcc
     https://sourceware.org/git/?p=glibc.git;a=commit;h=7650321ce037302bfc2f026aa19e0213b8d02fe6
 
+    This patch can be dropped when we are building with glibc 2.31+.

@@ -5,7 +5,7 @@ In order to be reproducible regardless of the architecture used to build
 the package, map all guix store prefixes to something fixed, e.g. /usr.
 
 We might be able to drop this in favour of using --with-nonshared-cflags
-when we being using newer versions of glibc.
+when we begin using newer versions of glibc.
comments.body: As the `--with-nonshared-cflags` was introduced in glibc 2.29, does it mean we can be more explicit about "newer version"?

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -4,6 +4,8 @@ See also: http://lists.busybox.net/pipermail/buildroot/2020-July/590376.html.
 
 https://sourceware.org/git/?p=glibc.git;a=commit;h=0b9c84906f653978fb8768c7ebd0ee14a47e662e
 
+This patch can be dropped when we are building with glibc 2.28+.

@@ -17,6 +17,8 @@ Date:   Fri May 6 11:03:04 2022 +0100
     https://sourceware.org/git/?p=glibc.git;a=commit;h=18363b4f010da9ba459b13310b113ac0647c2fcc
     https://sourceware.org/git/?p=glibc.git;a=commit;h=7650321ce037302bfc2f026aa19e0213b8d02fe6
 
+    This patch can be dropped when we are building with glibc 2.31+.

@@ -17,6 +17,8 @@ Date:   Fri May 6 11:03:04 2022 +0100
     https://sourceware.org/git/?p=glibc.git;a=commit;h=18363b4f010da9ba459b13310b113ac0647c2fcc
     https://sourceware.org/git/?p=glibc.git;a=commit;h=7650321ce037302bfc2f026aa19e0213b8d02fe6
 
+    This patch can be dropped when we are building with glibc 2.31+.
comments.body:
> According to https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=26332:

According to the same thread it was backported to 2.31. Which is all that matters for us.

> "2.31+" means ">=2.31", right?

Yes.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -4,6 +4,8 @@ See also: http://lists.busybox.net/pipermail/buildroot/2020-July/590376.html.
 
 https://sourceware.org/git/?p=glibc.git;a=commit;h=0b9c84906f653978fb8768c7ebd0ee14a47e662e
 
+This patch can be dropped when we are building with glibc 2.28+.
comments.body:
> https://sourceware.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=24022:

Again. The thread says it was backported to 2.28, which is what matters for us.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -5,7 +5,7 @@ In order to be reproducible regardless of the architecture used to build
 the package, map all guix store prefixes to something fixed, e.g. /usr.
 
 We might be able to drop this in favour of using --with-nonshared-cflags
-when we being using newer versions of glibc.
+when we begin using newer versions of glibc.
comments.body: I don't think that gains us anything here, as it's implied we can only use `--with-nonshared-cflags` when it's actually available.
